abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column highlights concerns that have been raised about pledge made by world's advanced industrialized nations to devote $100 billion per year by 2020 to address effects of climate change on world's poorer countries; notes financing has been secured for only about half of goal, and that there is no internationally recognized definition for what constitutes climate aid.
lead_paragraph: Far from meeting a commitment of $100 billion a year by 2020 for developing nations, the richest countries have trouble defining what that would mean.

headline.main: Getting to $100 Billion in Climate Change Aid
headline.print_headline: Promises of Climate Change Aid Now Need Money to Back Them Up

snippet: Far from meeting a commitment of $100 billion a year by 2020 for developing nations, the richest countries have trouble defining what that would mean.

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
keywords.name: subject
